source.960bbcfb: O(n): 'n' is the length of input to your function
source.045b9651:
node1 = Node(12) 
node2 = Node(99) 
node3 = Node(37) 
node1.next = node2 # 12->99
node2.next = node3 # 99->37
source.bf983d78: Python is a "higher level" programming language, so you can accomplish a task with little code. However, there's a lot of code built into the infrastructure in this way that causes your code to actually run much more slowly than you'd think.
